sn2.8:1.2: Then, when the night had advanced, the young deva Tāyana, formerly the founder of a religious sect, of stunning beauty, illuminating the entire Jeta’s Grove, approached the Blessed One.
sn2.8:1.3: Having approached, he paid homage to the Blessed One, stood to one side, and recited these verses in the presence of the Blessed One:
sn2.8:2.4: A sage does not reach unity.
sn2.8:3.1: “If one would do what should be done,
sn2.8:4.2: A deed that later brings repentance.
sn2.8:4.3: Better done is the good deed
sn2.8:4.4: Which when done is not repented.
sn2.8:5.3: So the ascetic life, wrongly taken up,
sn2.8:6.3: A holy life that breeds suspicion,
sn2.8:7.1: ” This is what the young deva Tāyana said.
sn2.8:7.2: Having said this, he paid homage to the Blessed One and, keeping him on the right, he disappeared right there.
sn2.8:8.1: Then, when the night had passed, the Blessed One addressed the bhikkhus thus: “Bhikkhus,
sn2.8:8.2: last night, when the night had advanced, the young deva Tāyana, formerly the founder of a religious sect . approached me .
sn2.8:8.3: and in my presence recited these verses:
sn2.8:14.1: “This is what the young deva Tāyana said. Having said this, he paid homage to me and, keeping me on the right, he disappeared right there.
sn2.8:14.5: Tāyana’s verses are beneficial, bhikkhus, they pertain to the fundamentals of the holy life. ”
